title: Bug 49195: Error message is displayed when using port 1 as shutdown port with Windows service
description: When specifying <Server port="1" in server.xml, an error message is displayed when stopping Tomcat as a Windows service. However, the shutdown process still works. It has been observed that using System.exit(0) would work regardless of the shutdown port configuration. It is also suspected that jsvc may exhibit a similar behavior, although this has not been tested.
OB: When stopping the Tomcat service on Windows with port 1 specified as the shutdown port in server.xml, an error message is displayed.
EB: The error message should not be displayed when stopping the Tomcat service with port 1 specified as the shutdown port. The shutdown process should proceed without any error messages.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Install Tomcat as a service on Windows. 
2. Start the service. 
3. Stop the service. 
4. Shut down the server through an OS signal, such as calling Catalina.stop().
